clinical_study.brief_title: The Efficacy and Mechanism of Acupuncture Treatment in Patients With Subjective Cognitive Decline
clinical_study.official_title: Beijing Traditional Chinese Medicine Hospital Affiliated to Capital Medical University

lead_sponsor.agency: Beijing Hospital of Traditional Chinese Medicine

clinical_study.source: Beijing Hospital of Traditional Chinese Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates the efficacy and mechanism of acupuncture treatment in patients with subjective cognitive decline. Half of patients will receive acupuncture treatment for three months, while the other half will receive sham acupuncture treatment for three months.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in cognitive function summary score
primary_outcome.description: A comprehensive neuropsychological test is comprise of Animal Fluency and Boston Naming Test, Trail-Making Test Parts A and B scores, and Auditory Verbal Learning Test delayed recall and delayed recognition.

secondary_outcome.description: Neuroplasticity outcome changes are measured by structural MRI (including DTI), task MRI, resting MRI and arterial spin labeling.

other_outcome.measure: The degree of complaint in cognitive decline
other_outcome.description: measured by Subjective Cognitive Decline Questionnaire.

other_outcome.measure: The ability of facial recognition and direction
other_outcome.description: measured by Santa Barbara Sense of Direction scale
Measured by Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index
Measured by Hamilton Depression Scale and Hamilton Anxiety Scale

intervention.description: Acupuncture needles were placed at acupoints Baihui (DU20), Shenting (DU24), Fengfu (DU16), Fengchi (GB20), Danzhong (RN17), Zhongwan (RN12), Qihai (RN6), Neiguan (PC6), Zusanli (ST36), Xuehai (SP10), Xinshu (BL15), Yixi (BL45), Tongli (HT5), and Zhaohai(KI6). Electrodes were attached the needle holders of the Baihui (DU20) and Shenting (DU24). The acupuncture needles are inserted through the adhesive pads and are retained for 20 minutes in every course. Treatment will be conducted over a period of 3 months, at a frequency of two times per week.

Sham acupoint (SA) 1 located in the midpoint of Shuaigu and Touwei. SA 2 located in the midpoint of Touwei and Yangbai. SA 3 located in the midpoint of Tianyou and Tianrong. SA 4 located in 4 cun above umbilicus and 1 cun right of umbilical midline (UM). SA 5 located in 2 cun below umbilicus and 1 cun right of UM. SA 6 located in 1 cun outside the midpoint of Shaohai and Shenmen. SA 7 located in 3 cun below the Yanglingquan and middle of the gallbladder and bladder channels. SA 8 located in 6 cun above mediosuperior border of the patella. SA 9 and SA 10 located in 2 cun from the lower border of spinous process of sixth or fifth thoracic vertebra. SA 11 located in 1 cun outside the midpoint of Shaohai and Tongli. SA 12 located in the tip of the medial malleolus. Electrodes were attached the needle holders of the bilateral SA 2. Procedures, and other treatment settings were the same in the acupuncture group but with no skin penetration, electricity output, or needle manipulation.
